results.title: Metformin suppresses pro-inflammatory cytokines in vitreous of diabetes patients and human retinal vascular endothelium
results.text_hl: This study aims to test the hypothesis that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ suppresses @<m>DISEASE_Diabetic_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003930 @@@diabetic retinopathy@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Diabetic_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003930 @@@DR@@@) associated @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@intraocular inflammation@@@.

results.title: Metformin Treatment Is Associated with a Decreased Risk of Nonproliferative Diabetic Retinopathy in Patients with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus: A Population-Based Cohort Study
results.text_hl: Animal studies also indicated @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@'s protective effects against @<m>DISEASE_Diabetic_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003930 @@@DR@@@.

results.title: Metformin Reduces Vascular Assembly in High Glucose-Treated Human Microvascular Endothelial Cells in An AMPK-Independent Manner
results.text_hl: The present study shows that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ not only regulates metabolism, but also probably controls endothelial dysfunction, being important in preventing conditions where angiogenesis is exacerbated such as @<m>DISEASE_Diabetic_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003930 @@@diabetic retinopathy@@@ or @DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@nephropathy@@@.

results.title: Sodium-glucose co-transporter 2 inhibitor add-on therapy for metformin delays diabetic retinopathy progression in diabetes patients: a population-based cohort study
results.text_hl: Co-administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and SGLT2is may reduce the risk of @<m>DISEASE_Diabetic_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003930 @@@DR@@@ progression.

results.title: Inhibitory Action of Antidiabetic Drugs on the Free Radical Production by the Rod Outer Segment Ectopic Aerobic Metabolism
results.text_hl: Long-term use of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ was independently associated with a significantly lower rate of severe non-proliferative or proliferative @<m>DISEASE_Diabetic_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003930 @@@DR@@@ and significantly lower risk of development of @DISEASE_Macular_Degeneration @DISEASE_MESH:D008268 @@@AMD@@@.

results.title: Metformin and retinal diseases in preclinical and clinical studies: Insights and review of literature.
results.text_hl: We then explore the sparse but promising retrospective clinical data on @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@'s potential protective role in @<m>DISEASE_Diabetic_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003930 @@@DR@@@, @DISEASE_Macular_Degeneration @DISEASE_MESH:D008268 @@@AMD@@@, @DISEASE_Glaucoma_Open_Angle @DISEASE_MESH:D005902 @@@POAG@@@, and @DISEASE_Uveitis @DISEASE_MESH:D014605 @@@uveitis@@@.

results.title: A Drug-Drug Multicomponent Crystal of Metformin and Dobesilate: Crystal Structure Analysis and Hygroscopicity Property
results.text_hl: A drug-drug multicomponent crystal consisting of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@) and dobesilate (DBS) was prospectively connected by solvent cooling and evaporating co-crystallization using the multicomponent crystal strategy, not only to optimize the physicochemical properties of single drugs, but also to play a role in the cooperative effect of DBS with the potential vascular protective effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@ against @<m>DISEASE_Diabetic_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003930 @@@diabetic retinopathy@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Diabetic_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003930 @@@DR@@@).

citations.NLM: Jiang L, Hu X, Cai L. A Drug-Drug Multicomponent Crystal of Metformin and Dobesilate: Crystal Structure Analysis and Hygroscopicity Property Molecules. 2022 May 27;27(11):. PMID: 35684409

results.title: Association of metformin use with risk of newly onset neovascular age-related macular degeneration development.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ use was associated with reduced OR of @DISEASE_Glycogen_Storage_Disease_Type_II @DISEASE_MESH:D006009 @@@nAMD@@@, particularly in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ without @<m>DISEASE_Diabetic_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003930 @@@DR@@@.

citations.NLM: Khanna S, Shaw L, Hyman MJ, Zhang J, Hariprasad S, Soo J, Flores A, Skondra D. Association of metformin use with risk of newly onset neovascular age-related macular degeneration development. Retina. 2023 Oct 30;():. PMID: 38408173

results.title: Metformin Corrects Abnormal Circadian Rhythm and Kir4.1 Channels in Diabetes
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ could represent a critical pharmacological agent for preventing Muller cell @DISEASE_Heart_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D006331 @@@dysfunction@@@ observed in @SPECIES_9606 @@@human@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Diabetic_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003930 @@@DR@@@.

results.title: Impact of duration of treatments with metformin and sulfonylureas, individually or in combination, on diabetic retinopathy among newly diagnosed type 2 diabetic patients: a pooled cohort's analysis.
results.text_hl: This study aimed to evaluate the effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and SUs' medication time on @<m>DISEASE_Diabetic_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003930 @@@DR@@@ among newly diagnosed T2DM using a pooled analysis.
